message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses a peer-to-peer backup system that utilizes pairwise replication contracts between a data owner and a replicator. This involves optimizing replicas' placement depending on a specific optimization strategy, taking advantage of the heterogeneity of the machines and the network. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category, as well as the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses managing contracts, keeping them consistent, and adjusting them in response to dynamically changing environments, which could also place it in the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The paper also presents a scientific prototype and runs experiments on workstations and PlanetLab nodes, which could place it in the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the challenges of managing contracts on highly unreliable machines, which could also place it in the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category.
